required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Weight & Insulin Sensitivity on Reproductive Function in PCOS: Studies in Skeletal Muscle & Adipose
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Weight and Insulin Sensitivity on Reproductive Function in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: Studies in Skeletal Muscle and Adipose Tissue 'PULSE Ancillary Study'

brief_summary.textblock: The overall objective of this ancillary study is to obtain skeletal muscle and subcutaneous adipose tissue biopsies from women with polycystic ovary syndrome enrolled in the PULSE Study (NCT01482286).

detailed_description.textblock: Muscle and adipose tissues will be appropriately collected and banked for future studies such as to measure expression of candidate genes involved with carbohydrate and fat oxidation and mitochondrial function by RT-PCR, protein content by western blot, enzyme activity by enzymatic assays and to perform functional studies under varying conditions (for example before and after treatment with insulin, testosterone, serum) to quantify insulin signaling and carbohydrate and fat oxidation in primary human cultures.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Parent Study stopped due to poor recruitment and enrollment

arm_group.description: Overweight women with polycystic ovary syndrome. 20 - 40 years, inclusiveBody mass index ≥ 25kg/m2History of irregular menstrual cycles (fewer than 8 regular cycles in the past year)Clinical and/or biochemical androgen excess (Free androgen index>3.85 and/or hirsuitism rating ≥8)Anovulatory menstrual cycles (determined during screening)

study_pop.textblock:
Overweight women with polycystic ovary syndrome.
20 - 40 years, inclusive Body mass index ≥ 25kg/m2 History of irregular menstrual cycles (fewer than 8 regular cycles in the past year) Clinical and/or biochemical androgen excess (Free androgen index>3.85 and/or hirsuitism rating ≥8) Anovulatory menstrual cycles (determined during screening)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Enrolled in PULSE NCT01482286
Exclusion Criteria:
- Withdraw from PULSE NCT01482286

clinical_study.keyword: PCOS, Weight, Insulin Sensitivity, Reproductive Function
